extends BasicObject
    Neuron Copyright 2005 by Jeff Heaton(jeff@jeffheaton.com) Example program from Chapter 2 Programming Neural Networks in Java http://www.heatonresearch.com/articles/series/1/ This software is copyrighted. You may use it in programs of your own, without restriction, but you may not publish the source code without the author's permission.     • Field Detail

      • weightv

        public int[] weightv

      • activation

    • Constructor Detail

      • Neuron

        public Neuron(int[] in)
        The constructor. The weights between this neuron and every other neuron(including itself) is passed in as an array. Usually the weight between this neuron and itself is zero.
        Parameters:
        in - The weight vector.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPotencial

        public int actionPotencial(boolean[] x)
        This method is called to determine if the neuron would activate, or fire.
        Parameters:
        x - Neuron input
        Returns:
        If the neuron would activate, or fire
